reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
It's often said that those who can't do, teach.
It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics.
A great deal of expert knowledge is implicit, not explicit.
The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.
Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to interfere with their performance, so they often stay on autopilot.
When I first saw an elite diver do four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast.
His answer: "Just go up in a ball."
Experts often have an intuitive understanding of a route, but they struggle to clearly express all the steps to take.
Their brain dump is partially filled with garbage.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: 전문가들이 교직에 진출하도록 장려하기 위해
다양한 기술을 배우는 과정을 비교하기 위해
전문가들이 기초를 가르치는 데 어려움을 겪는 이유를 설명하기 위해
성공적인 수행을 위한 자동조종 상태의 중요성을 강조하기 위해
직관적 이해를 명시적 지식으로 전환하는 방법을 제시하기 위해

answer.explanation: 이 글은 '할 수 있는 사람은 기초를 가르칠 수 없다'는 주장을 중심으로, 전문가의 지식이 암묵적이고 자동화되어 있어 기초적인 원리나 단계를 명확하게 설명하기 어렵다는 현상을 설명하고 있습니다. 골프 선수, 와인 애호가, 다이빙 선수의 예를 통해 이러한 주장을 뒷받침합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
It's often said that those who can't do, teach.
It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics.
A great deal of expert knowledge is implicit, not explicit.
The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.
Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to interfere with their performance, so they often stay on autopilot.
When I first saw an elite diver do four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast.
His answer: "Just go up in a ball."
Experts often have an intuitive understanding of a route, but they struggle to clearly express all the steps to take.
Their brain dump is partially filled with garbage.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: The Road to Mastery: A Step-by-Step Guide
Implicit Knowledge: The Key to Success
The Curse of Expertise: Why Great Doers Can Be Bad Teachers
Golf, Wine, and Diving: A Study of Elite Performance
How to Unlock Your Intuitive Understanding

answer.explanation: 이 글은 특정 분야의 대가, 즉 '위대한 실행가'가 자신의 기술을 명확히 설명하지 못해 '나쁜 교사'가 될 수 있다는 '전문성의 저주' 현상을 다루고 있습니다. 이는 전문가의 지식이 너무 내재화되어 기초를 가르치기 어렵다는 글의 핵심 내용과 정확히 일치합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
It's often said that those who can't do, teach.
It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics.
A great deal of expert knowledge is implicit, not explicit.
The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.
Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to interfere with their performance, so they often stay on autopilot.
When I first saw an elite diver do four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast.
His answer: "Just go up in a ball."
Experts often have an intuitive understanding of a route, but they struggle to clearly express all the steps to take.
Their brain dump is partially filled with garbage.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: The most effective teachers are usually those who have recently learned the skill themselves.
Experts' knowledge becomes so implicit and automatic that they struggle to explain the basics clearly.
To become an expert, one must stop consciously thinking about the fundamental steps of a skill.
Explaining one's own performance process can actually improve an expert's high-level skills even further.
The best way to learn a new skill is by observing experts on autopilot.

answer.explanation: 이 글의 핵심 주장은 전문가의 지식은 명시적이기보다는 암묵적이어서, 숙달될수록 기초에 대한 의식적인 인식이 줄어들고 자동적으로 수행하게 된다는 것입니다. 이로 인해 전문가들은 자신의 기술을 초보자에게 명확하게 설명하는 데 어려움을 겪습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It's often said that those who can't do, teach. It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics. ( ① ) A great deal of expert knowledge is implicit, not explicit. ( ② ) Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to interfere with their performance, so they often stay on autopilot. ( ③ ) When I first saw an elite diver do four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast. ( ④ ) His answer: "Just go up in a ball." ( ⑤ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.**

options.text: ①
②
③
④
⑤

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 '숙달될수록 기초에 대한 의식적 인식이 줄어든다'는 내용입니다. 이는 ②번 앞 문장의 '전문가의 지식은 암묵적이다'라는 주장에 대한 구체적인 이유이자 과정에 해당합니다. 그리고 ②번 뒷 문장에서는 이 현상에 대한 실험적 증거(골프 선수와 와인 애호가 사례)를 제시하므로, 이론적 설명과 사례 사이에 위치하는 것이 가장 자연스럽습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It's often said that those who can't do, teach. It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics.

question_blocks.A: When I first saw an elite diver do four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast. His answer: 'Just go up in a ball.'
question_blocks.B: A great deal of expert knowledge is implicit, not explicit. The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.
question_blocks.C: Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to interfere with their performance, so they often stay on autopilot.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 '할 수 있는 자는 기초를 가르칠 수 없다'는 핵심 주장을 제시합니다. (B)는 그 이유를 이론적으로 설명합니다(지식의 암묵성). (C)는 (B)의 이론을 뒷받침하는 실험 결과와 예시(골프, 와인)를 제시합니다. (A)는 또 다른 구체적인 예시(다이빙)를 들어 주장을 더욱 강화하며 글을 이어갑니다. 따라서 '주장 → 이론적 설명 → 예시 1 → 예시 2'의 순서인 (B)-(C)-(A)가 가장 논리적입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics.
A great deal of expert knowledge is ______________________________. 
The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.
Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques...
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: acquired through formal education
easily transferred to novices
based on conscious, logical steps
implicit, not explicit
a result of pure natural talent

answer.explanation: 빈칸은 전문가가 기초를 가르치기 어려운 근본적인 이유를 설명하는 자리입니다. 뒤이어 나오는 문장들은 전문가가 기초에 대한 '의식적 인식'이 부족하고, 자신의 기술을 '설명하는 데 어려움을 겪는다'고 말합니다. 이는 전문가의 지식이 언어로 명확히 표현되지 않는 '암묵적인(implicit)' 것이지, 명확히 설명 가능한 '명시적인(explicit)' 것이 아니라는 의미입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It would be more ① `accurate` to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics. A great deal of expert knowledge is ② `implicit`, not explicit. The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals. Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a ③ `hard` time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to ④ `improve` their performance, so they often stay on autopilot. Experts often have an intuitive understanding of a route, but they struggle to ⑤ `clearly` express all the steps to take.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: accurate
implicit
hard
improve
clearly

answer.explanation: 본문은 전문가에게 자신의 기술을 설명하라고 요청하는 것이 그들의 자동화된 수행을 방해할 수 있다고 말합니다. 자동조종 상태에 있는 전문가에게 의식적인 분석을 요구하면 오히려 경기력이 저하될 수 있습니다. 따라서 설명을 요청하는 것이 경기력을 '향상시키는(improve)' 것이 아니라 '방해한다(interfere with)'고 해야 문맥상 자연스럽습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It would be more (A) `accurate` to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics. A great deal of expert knowledge is (B) `implicit`... the less conscious awareness you often have of the (C) `fundamentals`. ... is enough to (D) `interfere with` their performance... Experts often have an (E) `intuitive` understanding of a route...
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) accurate: correct in all details; exact
(B) implicit: suggested but not communicated directly
(C) fundamentals: the main or most important rules or principles
(D) interfere with: to prevent something from working or developing successfully
(E) intuitive: based on a process of careful and conscious logical thinking

answer.explanation: (E) intuitive(직관적인)는 신중하고 의식적인 논리적 사고 과정이 아니라, 느낌이나 본능에 기반한 이해를 의미합니다. 제시된 영영 풀이는 'intuitive'의 의미와 정반대되는 '분석적인' 또는 '논리적인'의 의미에 가깝습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The further you progress toward mastery, the (A) [less / more] conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals. Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a (B) [hard / easy] time describing their putting and tasting techniques... Experts often have an (C) [intuitive / logical] understanding of a route, but they struggle to clearly express all the steps to take.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: less - hard - intuitive
less - easy - logical
less - hard - logical
more - easy - intuitive
more - hard - intuitive

answer.explanation: (A) 숙달의 경지에 이를수록 기초에 대한 의식적인 인식은 '더 적어집니다(less)'. (B) 따라서 전문가들은 자신의 기술을 설명하는 데 '어려움을(hard)' 겪습니다. (C) 전문가의 이해는 단계별 논리가 아닌 '직관적인(intuitive)' 것입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
It's often said that those who can't do, teach.
It would be more accurate to say that those who can do, can't teach the basics.
A great deal of expert knowledge is implicit, not explicit.
The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals.
Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time describing their putting and tasting techniques ― even asking them to explain their approaches is enough to interfere with their performance, so they often stay on autopilot.
When I first saw an elite diver do four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast.
His answer: "Just go up in a ball."
Experts often have an intuitive understanding of a route, but they struggle to clearly express all the steps to take.
Their brain dump is partially filled with garbage.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 내용과 일치하는 것은?

options.text: 필자는 '할 수 없는 자가 가르친다'는 속담에 전적으로 동의한다.
전문가의 지식은 대부분 명시적이어서 쉽게 설명될 수 있다.
숙련된 골퍼에게 퍼팅 기술을 설명하도록 요청하면 경기력이 향상된다.
전문가는 자신의 기술을 직관적으로 이해하지만 모든 단계를 명확히 설명하는 데는 어려움을 겪는다.
엘리트 다이빙 선수는 자신의 기술을 매우 상세하고 과학적으로 설명했다.

answer.explanation: 본문의 마지막 두 문장은 '전문가들은 종종 경로에 대한 직관적인 이해를 가지고 있지만, 취해야 할 모든 단계를 명확하게 표현하는 데 어려움을 겪는다'고 명시하고 있습니다. 이는 선택지 ④의 내용과 정확히 일치합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: A great deal of expert knowledge ① [is / are] implicit, not explicit. The further you progress toward mastery, the less conscious awareness you often have of the fundamentals. Experiments show that skilled golfers and wine aficionados have a hard time ② [describing / to describe] their putting and tasting techniques... When I first saw an elite diver ③ [do / to do] four and a half somersaults, I asked how he managed to spin so fast.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 주어는 'A great deal of expert knowledge'입니다. 'a great deal of'는 양을 나타내며 뒤에 셀 수 없는 명사가 오므로, 단수 취급하여 동사 'is'를 사용해야 합니다.
'have a hard time (in) -ing'는 '~하는 데 어려움을 겪다'라는 의미의 관용적 표현입니다. 이 구문에서는 동명사가 와야 하므로 'describing'이 올바른 형태입니다.
'see'는 지각동사로, '지각동사 + 목적어 + 목적격 보어'의 5형식 구문에서 목적격 보어 자리에는 동사원형 또는 현재분사가 올 수 있습니다. 목적어인 'an elite diver'가 공중제비를 '하는' 능동 관계이므로 동사원형 'do'가 맞습니다.
